titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I wrote the cheques for the month's household accounts: & worked at the Yellowstone Pk. Lecture, which is becoming a nightmare. I attended the meeting of the Sherburn Trustees, but had to come away before the business had been concluded
in order to motor to Bishop Auckland there to attend the unveiling of the Bishop's portrait.
The Bishop made a very felicitous reply.
came with me in the Bishop of Jarrow's car. Ella took the Vice–Chancellor & M
Gee in our own car. I wrote to Lord Durham condoling with him on his brother's death.
